item.description: 泰森食品公司（Tyson Foods Inc.【原文：Tyson Foods Inc. will shut a meat plant in Kansas next year, eliminating 809 jobs, as the company seeks to slash costs amid a downturn in the beef industry.】

item.title: Microchip 表示将关闭亚利桑那州工厂，并更新了前景展望
item.description: 汽车、消费设备和其他产品芯片制造商微芯科技公司（Microchip Technology Inc.【原文：Microchip Technology Inc., a maker of chips for cars, consumer devices and other products, said it would close a plant in Tempe, Arizona, affecting about 500 employees.】

item.title: 美联储威廉姆斯称 "随着时间推移 "可能需要更多降息举措
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）表示，现在通胀和就业风险已变得更加平衡，官员们可能需要进一步降低利率，使政策趋于中性。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said officials will likely need to lower rates further to move policy to a neutral stance now that risks to inflation and employment have become more balanced.】

item.title: 威利斯称新西兰可能改变预算平衡报告方式
item.description: 新西兰财政部长尼古拉-威利斯（Nicola Willis）表示，在权衡是否应将某些政府所属机构包括在内时，新西兰可能会调整今后几年报告预算平衡的方式。【原文：New Zealand may adjust how it reports the budget balance in future years as it weighs whether certain government-owned agencies should be included, Finance Minister Nicola Willis said.】

item.title: 斯塔姆表示，英国不会在特朗普和欧洲盟友之间做出选择
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）表示，尽管人们担心美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）提高关税的计划会在盟友之间制造矛盾，但英国并不需要以其与美国的特殊关系为代价来换取与欧洲的联盟关系。【原文：The UK doesn’t need to trade off its special relationship with the US against its European alliances, Prime Minister Keir Starmer said, despite concern that President-elect Donald Trump’s plans to to ramp-up tariffs will drive a wedge between the allies.】

item.title: 利润缩水后嘉吉公司将在全球裁员数千人
item.description: 美国最大的私营企业嘉吉公司（Cargill Inc.【原文：Cargill Inc. is cutting thousands of jobs globally after the largest privately held company in the US missed profit targets.】

item.title: 杠杆贷款市场 560 亿美元交易日刷新纪录
item.description: 周一，随着借款人在感恩节假期后涌入市场，美国推出了超过 560 亿美元的杠杆贷款，打破了两周前创下的 340 亿美元的纪录。【原文：More than $56 billion of US leveraged loans launched Monday, as borrowers stormed the market after the Thanksgiving holiday, shattering a $34 billion record set two weeks ago.】

item.title: 亚马逊发布工具，降低数据中心对电力的需求
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的云计算部门正在推出它认为能使数据中心更高效运行的组件，此举有助于解决耗电服务器群对电网造成的日益严重的压力。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s cloud unit is rolling out components it says will make data centers run more efficiently, a move that could help address the growing strain power-hungry server farms are putting on the electrical grid.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒尔表示倾向于在 12 月降息
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）表示，他倾向于在本月晚些时候召开的官员会议上再次投票支持降息，尽管在此之前将公布的数据可能会证明维持利率稳定是合理的。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said he’s inclined to vote for another reduction in interest rates when officials meet later this month, though data due before then could make the case for holding them steady.】

item.title: 加纳经审查后从国际货币基金组织获得 3.6 亿美元付款
item.description: 在成功完成对其扩大信贷机制的第三次审查后，加纳从国际货币基金组织获得了 3.6 亿美元的付款。【原文：Ghana has unlocked a $360 million disbursement from the International Monetary Fund following a successful third review of its extended credit facility.】

item.title: 德意志银行在皮博迪煤炭贷款融资方中脱颖而出
item.description: 当皮博迪能源公司（Peabody Energy Corp. ）同意收购英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc）的煤炭资产时，只有一家欧洲贷款机构加入了美国投资银行家和私人信贷专家的行列，为这笔交易提供资金：德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）。【原文：When Peabody Energy Corp. agreed to buy the coal assets of Anglo American Plc, only one European lender joined the US investment bankers and private credit specialists financing the deal: Deutsche Bank AG.】

item.title: 富达基金提升埃隆-马斯克的 X 社交网络价值
item.description: 富达投资公司（Fidelity Investments）的共同基金在 10 月份将其持有的埃隆-马斯克的 X 公司股票价值增加了 32% 以上，这是自 2022 年底进行投资以来的最大单月增幅。【原文：A Fidelity Investments mutual fund increased the value of its equity stake in Elon Musk’s X by more than 32% in October, its largest monthly increase since making the investment in late 2022.】

item.title: 德国在 Northvolt 破产后承担 6 亿欧元债务
item.description: 德国将承担其开发银行向 Northvolt AB 提供的超过 6 亿欧元（6.29 亿美元）的债务，用于在该国建设一座电池厂。【原文：Germany will assume more than €600 million ($629 million) of debt that its development bank extended to Northvolt AB for the construction of a battery plant in the country.】

item.title: 首席财务官称，随着市场增长，美国移动将发行更多比索债券
item.description: 美国移动股份公司（America Movil SAB）财务总监表示，该公司计划发行更多比索计价债务，优先考虑墨西哥市场，因为这家电信公司希望使其融资结构与收入相一致。【原文：America Movil SAB plans to issue more peso-denominated debt, prioritizing the Mexican market as the telecommunications company looks to align its financing structure with its revenues, its finance chief said.】

item.title: 加拿大马赫公司洽谈帮助电动巴士制造商 Lion 公司脱困
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，加拿大房地产开发商马赫集团（Groupe Mach Inc.【原文：Mach Capital, the investment arm of Canadian real estate developer Groupe Mach Inc., is in discussions to provide more funding to cash-strapped electric bus manufacturer Lion Electric Co., according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 腐败丑闻加重了哥伦比亚财政部长的压力
item.description: 哥伦比亚财政部长因涉嫌腐败丑闻而受到新的指控，就在政府努力应对日益加深的财政危机之际，这给总统古斯塔沃-佩特罗（Gustavo Petro）带来了更多的麻烦。【原文：Colombia’s finance chief has been hit with fresh accusations in an alleged corruption scandal, adding to complications for President Gustavo Petro just as the government tries to navigate a deepening fiscal crisis.】

item.title: 摩根大通全球投资银行部主席退休，加入埃森哲董事会
item.description: 摩根大通银行投资银行部全球主席珍妮弗-纳森（Jennifer Nason）在华尔街最大的贷款机构工作了近四十年后，即将从摩根大通银行退休。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s global chair of investment banking, Jennifer Nason, is set to retire from the bank after nearly four decades at Wall Street’s largest lender.】

item.title: 简街称前交易员嘲笑 "愚蠢 "的千禧年策略
item.description: 简街集团称，一名前交易员窃取了千禧年管理公司价值数十亿美元的印度期权秘密策略，该交易员曾嘲笑新雇主的策略是 "愚蠢的"。【原文：Jane Street Group said a former trader whom it claims stole secret billion-dollar India options strategies for Millennium Management previously ridiculed his new employer’s own strategies as “dumb.”】

item.title: 加拿大皇家银行晋升 Sian Hurrell 为欧洲资本市场部主管
item.description: 加拿大皇家银行提拔 Sian Hurrell 为欧洲资本市场业务主管。【原文：Royal Bank of Canada has promoted Sian Hurrell to lead its capital markets business in Europe.】

item.title: 芝加哥计划在预算僵局中再融资 8.06 亿美元债券
item.description: 芝加哥计划本周出售约 8.06 亿美元的市政债券，作为再融资的一部分，布兰登-约翰逊市长正努力在年底前弥补近 10 亿美元的预算缺口。【原文：Chicago is planning to sell about $806 million in municipal bonds this week as part of a refinancing as Mayor Brandon Johnson races to close a budget gap of nearly $1 billion by year end.】

item.title: Northvolt 任命 Markus Dangelmaier 为总厂首席执行官
item.description: Northvolt AB 已任命 Markus Dangelmaier 为 Northvolt Ett AB 的首席执行官，这是该公司唯一一家生产电池芯的工厂。【原文：Northvolt AB has named Markus Dangelmaier chief executive officer of Northvolt Ett AB, its only factory that’s producing battery cells.】

item.title: 首席执行官离职后，Stellantis 将启用美国老板和前首席财务官担任职务
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Stellantis NV 将提名包括北美公司老板 Antonio Filosa 在内的高管加入一个委员会，接替下台的首席执行官卡洛斯-塔瓦雷斯（Carlos Tavares），该汽车制造商正努力填补领导层的空缺。【原文：Stellantis NV will nominate executives including North America boss Antonio Filosa to a committee taking over from ousted Chief Executive Officer Carlos Tavares, according to people familiar with the matter, as the automaker works to fill a leadership void.】

item.title: 简街通过 10 亿美元贷款交易重返债务市场
item.description: 简街集团有限责任公司（Jane Street Group LLC）在周一的交易热潮中推出了一笔 10 亿美元的杠杆贷款，从而重返杠杆债务市场。【原文：Jane Street Group LLC is back in the leveraged debt markets after launching a $1 billion leveraged loan on Monday amid a rush of deals.】

item.title: 美联储主席博斯蒂克对 12 月利率决议保持 "开放 "态度
item.description: 亚特兰大联邦储备银行行长拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）表示，他还没有决定本月是否需要降息，但仍认为官员们应在未来几个月继续降息。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic said he’s undecided on whether an interest-rate cut is needed this month, but still believes officials should continue lowering rates over the coming months.】

item.title: Prime Capital 收购瑞典 RES 公司的绿色航空燃料项目
item.description: 德国资产管理公司 Prime Capital AG 收购了瑞典的一个合成航空燃料项目，这是在最近遭遇挫折后对该国绿色技术转型的一个推动。【原文：German asset manager Prime Capital AG bought a synthetic aviation fuel project in Sweden, in a boost for the nation’s green-tech transition after recent setbacks.】

item.title: 摩根大通交易员的计算结果显示：月底前标普 500 指数将接近 6,300 点
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Even after the strongest rally since the early days of the dot-com boom, the S&P 500 Index still has room to push higher through the end of the year, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s trading desk.】

item.title: 审计长称加拿大对科维德时代数十亿商业贷款的监管失误
item.description: 加拿大审计长表示，加拿大政府在 "科威德-19 "大流行期间向企业发放了 490 亿加元（约合 348 亿美元）贷款，却没有 "适当考虑资金的价值"。【原文：The Canadian government rolled out C$49 billion ($34.8 billion) in loans to businesses during the Covid-19 pandemic without “due regard for value for money,” the country’s auditor general said.】

item.title: 克里姆林宫终止对俄罗斯部门的控制后嘉士伯股价上涨
item.description: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）签署法令结束政府对嘉士伯俄罗斯业务的控制后，嘉士伯公司股价上涨。【原文：Carlsberg A/S shares rose after Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a decree ending government control of the brewer’s Russian business.】

item.title: 惠誉下调奥克兰信用评级，加州城市努力弥补预算缺口
item.description: 惠誉评级公司（Fitch Ratings）将加利福尼亚州奥克兰市的信用评级下调了两级，理由是在政治领导层更迭的情况下，该市面临着填补预算缺口的挑战。【原文：Oakland, California, had its credit rating cut two levels by Fitch Ratings, which cited the challenge of plugging budget gaps amid a change in political leadership.】
